oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Land indenture from Annanias McCoy to Samuel Houston, signed by Jackson as judge
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Land indenture or conveyance between grantor Annanias McCoy and grantee Samuel Houston for 300 acres of land in Knox County, on the north side of the Clinch River. Houston paid 200 dollars for this tract. Jackson, as judge, certified the document. The grantee appears to be Sam Houston's father or perhaps another relation.
In 1798, Governor John Sevier appointed Jackson judge of the Superior Court of Law and Equity. He served in this capacity until 1804.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: McCoy, Annanias
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Jackson, Andrew, 1767-1845
